markers.locationName: 19 Union Square: New York, New York 10003
markers.info: Ann Nelson, Doig’s agent, is author, Aaron Asher is the recipient. Publishing Company is Farrar, Straus & Giroux, Inc. In NY. Ann is persuading Aaron to publish Doig by enclosing two sections of his Half-Life ms. She is lobbying for him by describing his works and what he has accomplished.
Author Carol Hill, recipient Ann Nelson. Hill is considering publishing Half-Life, she describes it as “an unusual kind of book”. She needs time to decide but it is under “serious consideration”.

Natalie Chapman is the author, recipient is Ann Nelson. Rejection letter, stating it would be a better “regional published” book. Chapman was glad to have read it and thinks it does hold some value, but it does not make economic and regional sense for them to publish it.

Author Carol Hill, Senior Editor of HBJ in NY, recipient Doig. Editorial changes to HoS. The changes are in reference to description and word choice, she claims them to be “too much lyrical abstraction”. There were also uneven anecdotes that “weren’t adding too much at that point”. Hill also claims an admiration and excitement to be publishing the book at this stage.
Response on editorial changes to HoS ms. Doig is author, Carol Hill is the recipient. Defending his word choice and descriptive details.
D.L. Doig homestead in Tierney Basin near Sixteen, MT. Letter from Nancy Anderson
